title: When I See Apple, I See Green
summary:
Apple (AAPL) has been creeping higher the past several weeks.
AAPL is above the rising 50-day moving average line and above the rising 200-day moving average line.
The daily On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line shows strength from early April as buyers have been more aggressive.
The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator moved above the zero-line last month for an outright go-long signal.
Here the chart shows a possible price target of $424.
authors: While Some Analysts Might Suggest A Potential Double-Top Pattern
I Think We'Ll See Higher Prices -- Not A Downside Reversal.
text:
Apple (AAPL) has been creeping higher the past several weeks. Slow and steady, day after day, but now prices are just a shade below their January and February highs, and there doesn't seem to be much overhead resistance. While some analysts might suggest a double-top pattern is possible, I think we'll see higher prices and not a downside reversal. Let's look closer.

In this daily bar chart of AAPL, below, we can see a bullish alignment of prices and indicators. AAPL is above the rising 50-day moving average line and above the rising 200-day moving average line. The daily On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line shows strength from early April as buyers have been more aggressive. The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator moved above the zero-line last month for an outright go-long signal.

In this first Point and Figure chart of AAPL, below, we can see the uptrend in price. AAPL is just a few "boxes" from a new high trade and breakout. The volume by price bars on the left side of the chart shows that there was not a lot of volume traded at the prices above $318.32 so we should not anticipate much in the way of selling resistance.

In this second Point and Figure chart of AAPL, below, we used weekly price data. Here the chart shows a possible price target of $424.

Bottom line strategy: Stay long shares of AAPL recommended in previous updates. Raise sell stops to $301. $350 and then $400-$424 are the price targets.

                 itemprop="articleBody">
                <div data-paragraph-count="1" class="placement-fixed" id="div-placement-fixed-0.1537166123244582" data-total-word-count="287" data-article-has-video="false" data-article-fixed-placement="articleTop"></div><div id="div-placement-fixed-0.3327149749558115" class="placement-fixed" data-page-count="1" data-page-word-count-total="288" data-total-page-count="1" data-article-fixed-placement="pageTop"></div> <div id="div-placement-para-0.5136420458652854" data-image-at-index="-1" class="placement-para" data-paragraph-word-count-total="62" data-page-paragraph-middle="false" data-page-word-count-so-far="0" data-page-word-count-total="288" data-page-paragraph-count-total="1" data-page-paragraph-count-so-far="1" data-article-word-count-so-far="0" data-article-word-count-total="287" data-article-paragraph-count-so-far="1" data-article-paragraph-count-total="1"></div><p>Apple  (<a href="/quote/AAPL.html">AAPL</a>)  has been creeping higher the past several weeks. Slow and steady, day after day, but now prices are just a shade below their January and February highs, and there doesn't seem to be much overhead resistance. While some analysts might suggest a double-top pattern is possible, I think we'll see higher prices and not a downside reversal. Let's look closer.   </p> <div>    </div> <div>  In this daily bar chart of AAPL, below, we can see a bullish alignment of prices and indicators. AAPL is above the rising 50-day moving average line and above the rising 200-day moving average line. The daily On-Balance-Volume (OBV) line shows strength from early April as buyers have been more aggressive. The Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) oscillator moved above the zero-line last month for an outright go-long signal.   </div> <div>    </div> <div>  <img src="//s.thestreet.com/files/tsc/v2008/photos/contrib/uploads/450a5c65-9476-11ea-95cd-db540157221f.gif" alt="" width="600">   </div> <div>    </div> <div>  In this first Point and Figure chart of AAPL, below, we can see the uptrend in price. AAPL is just a few "boxes" from a new high trade and breakout. The volume by price bars on the left side of the chart shows that there was not a lot of volume traded at the prices above $318.32 so we should not anticipate much in the way of selling resistance. </div> <div>    </div> <div>  <img src="//s.thestreet.com/files/tsc/v2008/photos/contrib/uploads/4ea68916-9476-11ea-95cd-41e35da9113e.png" alt="" width="600">   </div> <div>    </div> <div>  In this second Point and Figure chart of AAPL, below, we used weekly price data. Here the chart shows a possible price target of $424.   </div> <div>    </div> <div>  <img src="//s.thestreet.com/files/tsc/v2008/photos/contrib/uploads/5db9c9d7-9476-11ea-95cd-c1be9ea81235.png" alt="" width="600">   </div> <div>    </div> <div>  <strong>Bottom line strategy:</strong> Stay long shares of AAPL recommended in previous updates. Raise sell stops to $301. $350 and then $400-$424 are the price targets.  </div> <div>    </div> <div>  <em>(AAPL is a holding in Jim Cramer's </em>  <em><a href="https://secure2.thestreet.com/cap/prm.do?OID=038652">Action Alerts PLUS member club</a></em>  <em>. Want to be alerted before Jim Cramer buys or sells this stock? </em>  <em><a href="https://secure2.thestreet.com/cap/prm.do?OID=038652">Learn more now</a><a href="https://secure2.thestreet.com/cap/prm.do?OID=038652">.</a></em>  <em>)</em> </div> <div data-paragraph-count="1" class="placement-fixed" id="div-placement-fixed-0.331753084422988" data-total-word-count="287" data-article-has-video="false" data-article-fixed-placement="pageEnd"></div><div data-paragraph-count="1" class="placement-fixed" id="div-placement-fixed-0.25250053260449945" data-total-word-count="287" data-article-has-video="false" data-article-fixed-placement="articleEnd"></div>
            </div>
